section.section: Except as provided in subsections (b) and (c) of this section, a lender may charge interest on a loan at a rate not more than the rates specified in this subsection.

For any loan with an original principal balance of $2,000 or less, the maximum interest rate is:
2.75 percent interest per month on that part of the unpaid principal balance not more than $500;
2 percent interest per month on that part of the unpaid principal balance that is more than $500 but not more than $700; and
1.25 percent interest per month on that part of the unpaid principal balance that is more than $700.
For any loan with an original principal balance of more than $2,000 and not more than $3,500, the maximum interest rate is 1.75 percent interest per month on the unpaid principal balance of the loan.
For any loan with an original principal balance of more than $3,500 and not more than $5,000, the maximum interest rate is 1.5 percent interest per month on the unpaid principal balance of the loan.
For any loan with an original principal balance of more than $5,000, the maximum interest rate is 1.35 percent interest per month on the unpaid principal balance of the loan.

text.section: If any principal balance remains unpaid 6 months after the loan matures as originally scheduled or deferred, the lender may not contract for, charge, or receive interest at a rate exceeding 6 percent simple interest per annum on the actual unpaid principal balances from time to time.
If the lender refinances a loan in the ordinary course of business, he may not add to the principal balance or deduct from the proceeds of the new loan more than 60 days' interest then due.

section.section: The lender shall compute interest on the actual unpaid principal balances outstanding from time to time, and he may not contract for, charge, or receive interest in advance or compounded interest.
For each day on which an unpaid principal balance is outstanding, the lender may charge on that unpaid balance 1/30th of the interest permitted under this subtitle to be charged for 1 month.

For purposes of this section, each of the 12 calendar months in the year shall be treated as having 30 days, as follows:
The last day of each month which has 31 days shall be omitted; and
The necessary number of days shall be added at the end of February to make 30 days.

text.section:
The maximum term of any loan made under this subtitle may not exceed:
For any loan with an original principal balance of $700 or less, 30 months and 15 days;
For any loan with an original principal balance of more than $700 but less than $2,000, 36 months and 15 days; and
For any loan with an original principal balance of $2,000 or more, 72 months and 15 days.
